name: mrclarinet
text: I'm guessing this is probably a bit more resonant for Americans than it is for me.

name: purplehaze
text: Oh yes, this is our culture condensed into weapons-grade form.

name: bovine
text: yes. I have a 'Suggestive Service' speech like that at the place i part time. The Dignities prevent me from delivering it.

name: bovine
text: A comment left by bovine was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Jesus, VictoriaW, dj)

name: duskbringer
text: Are the hot guts spicy? Can I get them Mild? Do you guys do cheeseburgers?

name: bovine
text: you can get them mild or without sauce all together. the cheeseburgers you can has also. for 2.99 extra i'll assume the fetal position so you can scoop easier.

name: umbra
text: no thanks I have a condition

name: soticoto
text: No thanks, I don't want a condition.

name: kilroywashere
text: chubby for 'can has', but I felt worse about myself afterward

name: deusoma
text: I did the same thing, but I wouldn't have noticed if you hadn't pointed it out. How does that make you feel?

name: kilroywashere
text: Not much different, to be honest.

name: purplehaze
text: Next time I'm at a Ruby Tuesday, I'll quote this strip to our waiter. If that is you, respond in appropriate form.

name: greatwhitehope7
text: Do you work at Bob Evans by any chance?

name: johnstephens
text: A comment left by johnstephens was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, nutmeg, Darthemed, turkfish)

name: gunsofray
text: you gained a chubby for me nt being able to pronounce the last word

name: lawbot
text:
One time in America I went to a Mexican restaurant and it was nice. It was in their nation's capital.

I have eaten many other mexican meals in America.

name: gumfish
text: I like this story.

name: neck_romancer
text: queso packer? excuse me?

name: howard
text: the dish is packin' the spanish cheese

name: purplehaze
text: Apparantly, the more kitsch you get, the thicker your outlines are.

name: whalethief
text: I can't believe it. This is exactly what its like to go to a Tex Mex  place with my dad... only instead of being like Ray and ordering everything offered he also tries to speak spanish to the staff even though the last time we went out to one of these places we had an asian waitress.

name: madnes
text: Please Fed-ex your father to me. I am casting a sit-com.

name: tekende
text: My god, I love this comment so much.

name: rumblefish
text: Seriously. I went to chubby it only to find that I had already done so. While my memory deteriorates rapidly my sense of humour remains essentially intact apparently.

name: semiquaver
text:
I have nothing clever to say about this, but I must let this one thing out:

YOU. ARE. NOT. ALONE.

name: methadone
text: why is beef so bent out of shape? we all know ray is paying

name: zefiel
text: It is wrong on principle to pay so much for food. It is Asinine.

name: spinynorman
text: because he has a terrible case of the dignities

name: themolt
text: Now, you just wanted to say the word "asinine" and have it mean something.

name: soticoto
text: Because Beef already has a fiesta name and it would get such bad things done to his food.

name: aarongstock
text:
I fall for the word chipotle every freakin' time I see it on a menu. I know it's there, I know how it has altered my ordering habits, and yet... and yet...

The restaurant equivalent of Advertising Age must have run an article on the hypnotic effect of the word "chipotle" in the past couple years.

name: thedudeabides85
text: That is exactly my feeling, but it extends even past food.  I would buy a Kia if the salesman told me he had one available in "Chipotle Brown".

name: grayfox
text: A comment left by grayfox was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, tekende, o2b, snoozebar, anitrophaeron)

name: farqussus
text: You'll want to hope the Kia never breaks down, because you're going to own it for the rest of your life. The only thing less likely than a man buying a Kia is a man buying a used Kia.

name: invidious
text: Kias aren't Fords, dude.  You can drive one down the road without fear of it blowing up every tenth of a mile.

name: farqussus
text: That's the problem.

name: semiquaver
text:
The problem is that there is a "fresh fast food" restaurant named Chipotle which I cannot see without going in and ordering a six dollar steak salad.

This is a problem.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it was the steak salad of my dreams!

name: gitarooman
text: Chipotle blows. Freebirds.

name: 7th_shot
text: Yanno, I didn't really think about it before, but you're right. When the guy mentioned the thing with chipotle, I was like, "Ray! Get that one!"

name: sunday
text: That is because chipotle is delicious.

name: spicyponyhead
text: One of the best things in the world to eat is chipotle-bacon macaroni & cheese. Totally worth fucking around with a recipe and grating cheese and such.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: meh. i'm all about straight up Kraft mac & cheese. following that 1/4 cup milk and 4 tbsp butter biz to tha T ! nothin' better.

name: dartigen
text: ...I make mine from scratch. Cook macaroni, make a basic white sauce from cornflour, butter and milk, add cheese and Dijon mustard to sauce, mix cooked macaroni with sauce, serve. Takes longer, but tastes infinitely better.

name: purplehaze
text: I dig the incorrect use of the tilde on 'bueño', too.

name: bacter
text:
Also notice the ñ in "Muy Bueño".
I'm pretty sure that doesn't mean anything.
That would be like "muy bwayn-yo" not "muy bwyen-oh"

name: zefiel
text:
Woah, Bacter is back! Anyway, 'Muy bueno' (very good) is always misused. the correct thing to say would be 'Muy Bien'. (very well) The basic thing to remember is that bueno only applies to something, like a quesadilla, and not a general situation. Also there's the whole male/female words in spanish, but usually an 'a' at the end of the word will suffice

'Esta quesadilla es muy buen a !'


/sorry but i'm studying to be a translator.

name: zefiel
text:
Sorry, an 'a' at the end of the word will suffice when the thing we're dealing with is female.

'Esa perr a es muy molesta!'


/yeah, i am healthy from The Dignities

name: andrew_
text: Translation: This female dog is very Asherdan.

name: zefiel
text: Te he dado una gorda.

name: andrew_
text: Gracias por la gorda .

name: featurelessvoid
text:
El Assetbar me dice, "Tu ya has dado bastantes gordas en esta pagina, Amistoso."
(Sorry if I messed that up; I just realized that I haven't read or spoken Spanish in almost 20 years.)

name: andrew_
text:
El Assterbar me dijo eso, tambien!

Zefiel, tell me if I'm doing this right.

name: zefiel
text: Both comments are way good, I'm hella proud of you guys.

name: tellumo
text: ¡Hoy en Español!

name: atticusonline
text: El perro caliente es muy aburrido!

name: andrew_
text: Doesn't Darin' Aaron Magoo realize that Mr. Quiet has a condition?

name: mrclarinet
text: I don't see why Beef's so hacked off.  I'd take a mini sundae over a dumb name any day.

name: peppermint
text: it landed on the tombstone. the sundae is consolation for being shot four times in the torso by banditos.

name: byronic
text: For Beef, it allways lands on the tombstone. Poor Beef. He'll have nightmares again tonight.

name: audhumla
text: Oh Man I Am Definitely Jammin'

name: gage
text: Was Beef afraid that he would discover Molly working there after leaving her job at Taco Bell?

name: robobogle
text: Isn't she still working at Starbucks?

name: katsura
text: yeah, who could forget the hand-flavored frappuchino that led to Beef and Molly's engagement?

name: k_buttsworthe
text:
i take my handachino® with a shot of vanilla, less ice with a half shot of espresso

(ex starbucks employee)

name: bovine
text: you know what is SO FUNNY. The drink ends up tasting essentially like thick sugar no matter how many paragraphs it takes you to order it.

name: k_buttsworthe
text: you have discovered their secret. i got a case of the dignities and quit.

name: boredom_man
text:
Yeah, well, examine their customers.

[IMGS OFF]

name: charchar
text:
Manuccino? (from Ital. mano- hand , because Starbucks is totally concerned with proper Italian etymology in their comestible nomenclature.

I guess 'Manuccino' doesn't work either.

name: boredom_man
text: I just order with an eight-second scream.

name: spinynorman
text: Beef has a rough time with Tex-Mex. Last time some guy was about to take a dump in the taco.

name: geysershitdick
text: This is almost exactly how it is.

name: taiiga
text: FiestaMax seems to be a pretty gimmicky joint, and beef ain't a gimmicky man.

name: tellumo
text:
this is how I feel whenever I go to a Mexican place that has few or no Mexicans running the place.

SF BAY AREA TAQUERIAS 4 LYFE!!!!!!! word up, homes!

name: porquechutzpah
text:
the best place for mexican food is the restaurant open until 3 am across from the discoteca sanchez 2000 and the furia where the staff speaks no english, and the waitress has a baby strapped to her back.

in austin, that place is across the street from it's vietnameese equal.

name: jackparsons
text: And the mariachi busker who cruises through playing at tables.

name: firesign
text:
It's sad that the problem outlined in this strip has necessitated various checks and balances for the real Mexican places such as the one described in your comment; there's a really good one here that always asks "onions and cilantro ok?" and "corn tortilla ok?" when I order Tacos de Carne Asada, for fear of American horror when their customer finds anything other than a crispy shell, ground beef, lettuce and cheddar on their plate when ordering something called a "taco"...

As if I would prefer iceberg lettuce to a nice bed of onions and cilantro...

name: alejandroadam
text: I prefer the El Salvadorian spots, much more authentic, and you can't order in English, because no one speaks it

name: spicyponyhead
text: Mmmm, Mission district tacos.

name: fineoakstructure
text: for some reason I first read this as "Mission: Distr a ct Tacos"

name: mikeleffel2
text: bwahah! I love how smiley Ray is in the final panel! Also all the wordplay is excellent!

name: padijun
text:
beef is undoubtedly thinking about the fact that one of their quesadillas has over 1200 calories

seriously a typical meal from q'doba gas about that much

did you know a bloomin' onion from outback has almost 2000 calories

name: hollybones
text: he is more concerned about the sodium content.

name: bovine
text: good thing you get fried oil shivers after eating about a third of one. its a safety mechanism.

name: blastradius
text: A comment left by blastradius was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, robobogle, Sargasm)

name: wehavemagnums
text: I was thinking similar thoughts

name: wehavemagnums
text: Although not immediately relevant this strip did remind me of something. About a month ago, a waiter drew up a chair and sat on it backwards as he guided my family through the intricacies of the Pizza Hut menu.

name: bovine
text: 'Let's see....we have pizza, which is bread, with sauce...also there are toppings...meat and vegetables...and one fruit...can you guess? Yes exactly! Pineapple!

name: lugosh
text:
Sometimes one can obtain pizza with banana on.

That makes two.

name: tekende
text: That's disgusting.

name: thommy_h
text: I'm a big fan of the waiter's ear piercing - it's another one of those "hey, they are cats" moments.

name: stza
text: i think it should've been a ChokkaOaxaca sundae.

name: ttagxamm
text: Muy bien!  I do not know how to say I am all out of chubbies in Spanish.

name: tekende
text: N...no mas boners?

name: ttagxamm
text:
Si! No mas boners es bueno! I think?
In any case it will have to do, and I still haven't got any to give...

name: skiddyfisk
text: This mexican restaurant waiter is reminiscient of Nice Pete.

name: julia
text: I find the facial hair, bowling shirt and earring of the waitcat to be unpleasantly reminiscent of those living in suburban parental basements and arguing with people about continuity in Lord of the Rings.

name: robobogle
text:
The facial hair, bowling shirt and earring are all part of the "FIESTA MAX!" required uniform.

Since Darin' Aaron is still in his "FIESTA MAX! FIESTA PROBATIONARY PERIOD!" he isn't required to sport any flair yet.

name: ttagxamm
text:
No, the guys in bowling shirts are more likely clustered around the register at a dingy record shop arguing about math-rock and Pavement. The LotR dudes are in black slogan T-shirts, or in their boxers, arguing online.

(sometimes the Achewood fans do this too oh sweet reason what will I do with my life? )

name: kingsleymc
text: Ray is the kind of guy who would laugh and point at you for landing on the tombstone.

name: aperson
text: Nah, he's not laughing and pointing. He's saying " Damn this place is great! Beef, you just won a free sundae! You are a lucky devil! You must now surely agree that this establishment is the bomb, Beef. "

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Yeah, although I think it's not as much that Ray is psyched on Fiesta Max as that he's in his "I find this ugly dude named Napil to be hilarious!" mode.

name: songbirdspectre
text: The Dignities prevent me from even entering places such as TGI Fridays, Rainforest Cafe, Joe's Crab Shack, or Applebee's.

name: pyromancer
text: Freakin' rancidy-ass Outbacks.

name: songbirdspectre
text: heck yes.

name: boredom_man
text: All with the Coldstone Creamery management chillin' at the bar...

name: jackparsons
text: Grizzlebee's (from Sealab 2020)

name: tekende
text:
Joe's Crab Shack sucks.

Rainforest Cafe is actually pretty decent--PLUS, plus, you can have a a lot of fun if you wait till none of the servers are looking at you and then yell "VOLCANO!" and listen as all the other servers shout "VOLCANO!", even though there is no volcano desert forthcoming. My friends and I did this once at the Rainforest Cafe in Disney World. Hilarious.

name: jrpigman
text:
Apparently my Fiesta Name is Quick-Draw Clyde Candybuns.

I think that waiter is coming on to me.

name: aperson
text:
[IMGS OFF]

He's lost weight.

name: songbirdspectre
text: i love that nasty white area around his head. awesome. such chubbies.

name: aperson
text: Don't hate me, honey bile duct.

name: zedpower
text: You should not need both hands to hold a junior-mini children's sundae. I bet they serve the regular size sundae in a wheelbarrow.

name: biff
text: Ray asks for chips.  You normally can't avoid chips in a TexMex restaurant.  Darin' Aaron is definitely still in his probationary period.

name: joeyramoney
text: chances are they'll be those nasty fried flour tortillas as opposed to corn.

name: son_of_selleck
text: what makes this strip a 5 for me are the perfectly juxtaposed reactions of Ray and beef to this ridiculous situation. Ray wallows in the utter chintzy frivolity of the entire venture, for all his pretensions to class and style. Beef on the other hand, despite being from circumstances and acting hoi polloi and low in fancier climes, nonetheless has a massive attack of the dignities. I personally think this speaks to a subtle growth in Beef's sense of self-worth: I would hazard that an earlier, pre molly RB would not have enough ego to feel properly ridiculed by this situation.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: previously seen in this blog by a one Mr. R. Beef Kazenzakis.

name: sargasm
text: Where Aarons Dare

name: ocarinak
text: I get the feeling that Chris just came back from a visit to Rainforest Cafe with his shortle.

name: tekende
text: Shortle? Is that like when a young girl, in her young girlish glee, chortles?

name: twoply
text: Beef is about keeping it real and this place is just as authentic as Jack in the Box tacos. Plus any hardcore Mexican-American food dude needs to back his homestead taco stand. Roberto's Mexican food for life!!! (Vegas Chapter)

name: nonentity
text: Jack in the Box tacos are made from a mixture of beef and TVP (That's Textured Vegetable Protein, for the layman). It's a soy-based product. So, it's a mix of beef and soy. Hooray!

name: twoply
text: My intake of soy is already at a maximum. Any more and I'll need Beano and a gentlemanly fan. Kudos to Jack in the Crack , however.

name: steerpike66
text: Oh God, this is so horrible and apt. The asinine names that give no pleasure except to the retarded (sorry Ray, but it's true) the horrible, sweat-inducing choices. The phoniness. I'm with Beef's angry eyebrows all the way. Ray looks stupid in the last frame. If someone pointed and made a 'woo' face at to me, I'd throw my free sundae at him.

name: steerpike66
text: They have an APPETIZER at Ruby Tuesday that has 2400 calories in it. That kind of fat makes you stupid. It clogs up the canals in your brain and makes you describe every dumb atrocity as 'cute' with a good-natured laugh.

name: katsura
text: I went to a Ruby Tuesday's for my birthday once and got a free sundae while everyone sang at me. While this is marginally better than the tombstone deal, nowadays I'd be with Beef in that situation.

name: joeyramoney
text: there is an implacable but vital difference between being sung to and sung at.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: similar to talking 'to' and talking 'at' someone.

name: robobogle
text: I think that most appetizers are meant to be shared. If you had 6 people at your table 2400 calories split wouldn't be too bad, keeping in mind the average restaurant burger has about 3 days worth of your recommended saturated fat intake.

name: freakusmcgee
text: I think what's important here is how much we need some sort of a Flash or Java spinner to enable us - the laypeople - to also get access to our Fiesta names.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Ooh! Let me not get right on that.

name: joeyramoney
text: the pierced right ear is a subtle touch.

name: tetsujin
text: Flavored Iced Margaritas: for the family dining connoisseur who wants an exciting new way to order a watered-down drink.

name: tekende
text: One time I had a frozen margarita at Taco Cabana, of all places, and for some reason it was strong as all get out. I didn't even finish the whole thing and I was smashed. Had to have a friend drive afterward.

name: dwilow
text: I bet they sell oil salads and riblets.

name: overmedicated
text: For... for the monotremes?

name: javonathan
text: Beef says he hates on wipe-down Tex Mex joints. Now I, too, shall hate on wipe-down franchises.

name: plezure
text:
My fiesta name is Meatball Salad.
Ensalda de albondigas.

name: jackparsons
text:
Ensalada.

30 years ago I spoke spanish. I can't remember the words but I know all of the grammatical rules.

name: vorrishnikov
text:
I was at first wondering who in hell thought that tex-mexicans created funny names for themselves instead of drinking at parties, but then i remembered that Moe's has strange names for their food, such as "billy barou" or "art vandalay." neither of those names have a tex-mexican origin.

That said, Moe's might have some goofy ass names for their food, but damn it's good. Are there places that are really this obnoxious, and how good is their food? I'm going to play the role of ignorant american glutton and say that I don't really care about how authentic the cuisine is - I just want to know if it tastes good.

name: bovine
text: its impossible to make cheese fat and salt taste bad.

name: tekende
text: No, it isn't. Exhibit A: El Chico.

name: son_of_selleck
text: I went to a TGI Friday's chain in Beijing. I don't know if it is always like that, or whether the fact that I was served by surly chinese waiters made it more or less horrible.

name: captainpeepers
text: If I had to work there I would not share such enthusiasm.  I would wear a scowl of disappointment towards all of my customers.  It would not be happy times for them.

name: adam
text: I love Ray's expression in the final panel.

name: johnmatrix
text: Anyone else notice the stink line above Beef's head in the last panel?

name: ricochet
text: Aaron looks a bit like a skinny Rod Huggins

name: neonaoneo
text: Love Ray in the last panel. It's like he's expressing 'Dude you won a sundae! You da man!'

name: foetus_punch
text:
Third panel. Greatest.

I use "I have a terrible case of the Dignities" to this day.

name: fuckalgebra
text: This strip is a prime example of Onstad's ability to perfectly depict stuff that annoys the piss out of reasonable people but that they can't explain in words.

name: mattylite
text: Office Space.  Am I really the first person who's gonna point out the similarities to the restaurant in Office Space?  The Dignities even seems like kind of a shout-out to that part where the guy accuses the guy of having a case of the Mondays.  Also, pizza shooters.  Just chew on that for a while.  Pizza shooters.

name: vheissu
text: Canada is heading in this direction. Why we can't borrow more culture from across the pond I will never understand. I also could not fathom the proper way to punctuate that last sentence.

name: dipstikk
text: no we don't i have a condition.

name: panamajack
text: I wonder if Phillipe named this restaurant.

name: carlyle
text:
I wonder if that man is filled with intense self loathing when not putting on such a great act.

I mean, people don't actually like those jobs! 'Taint right!

name: redjoker
text: damn this strip gives me a case of suggestive diarea

name: shakey
text: in the last panel Ray seems to be really delighted that Beef got a free sundae
